remarks: Part of proof of Lemma E in [Crawley] p. 113. ` F ` and ` G ` represent f(s) and f_s(r).  Here show p ` \/ ` q = r ` \/ ` u at the top of p. 114.  (Contributed by NM, 7-Jun-2012.)
statement:
cdleme4.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
cdleme4.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
cdleme4.m $e |- ./\ = ( meet ` K ) $.
cdleme4.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
cdleme4.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
cdleme4.u $e |- U = ( ( P .\/ Q ) ./\ W ) $.
cdleme4 $p |- ( ( ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) /\ ( P e. A /\ Q e. A /\ ( R e. A /\ -. R .<_ W ) ) /\ R .<_ ( P .\/ Q ) ) -> ( P .\/ Q ) = ( R .\/ U ) ) $.
